TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class Float : Java.Lang.Number, IConvertible, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.Lang.IComparable

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Float extends Java.Lang.Number implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.Lang.IComparable, class System.IConvertible, class System.IDisposable
type Float = class inherit Number interface IConvertible interface IComparable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: The Float class wraps a value of primitive type float in an object.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int Compare (float f1, float f2);
.method public static hidebysig int32 Compare(float32 f1, float32 f2) cil managed
static member Compare : single * single -> int

Docs.summary: Compares the two specified float values.
Docs.returns: the value 0 if f1 is numerically equal to f2; a value less than 0 if f1 is numerically less than f2; and a value greater than 0 if f1 is numerically greater than f2.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 CompareTo(class Java.Lang.Float anotherFloat) cil managed

Docs.summary: Compares two Float objects numerically.
Docs.returns: the value 0 if anotherFloat is numerically equal to this Float; a value less than 0 if this Float is numerically less than anotherFloat; and a value greater than 0 if this Float is numerically greater than anotherFloat.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns a representation of the specified floating-point value according to the IEEE 754 floating-point "single format" bit layout.
Docs.returns: the bits that represent the floating-point number.

Docs.returns: the bits that represent the floating-point number.
